event_callback(data)[source]
execute_plan(plan)[source]

Execute a planned path @param: plan A plan path from the method compute_cartesian_path()

go_to_joint_state(joint_goal)[source]

Go to a joint state Example : [0, -2*pi/8, 0, -2*pi/4, 0, 2*pi/6] @param: joint_goal A list of floats in radian, a value per joint

go_to_pose_goal(pose_goal)[source]

Go to a pose goal in the end-effector frame (To change the method set_pose_reference_frame(), to go to a position with any orientation see set_position_target()) Example : list of 6 floats [x, y, z, rot_x, rot_y, rot_z] or a list of 7 floats (see quaternions) [x, y, z, qx, qy, qz, qw] Example : [0.4, 0.1, 0.4, 0, 0, 0, 1] @param: pose A list of floats

plan_cartesian_path(waypoints)[source]

Compute a path from a list of pose Example of pose : list of 6 floats [x, y, z, rot_x, rot_y, rot_z] or a list of 7 floats (see quaternions) [x, y, z, qx, qy, qz, qw] Example of path : [[0.4, 0.1, 0.4, 0, 0, 0, 1],

[0.4, 0.3, 0.3, 0, 0, 0, 1], [0.1, 0.1, 0.4, 0, 0, 0, 1], [0, 0.1, 0.4, 0, 0, 0, 1]]

@param: waypoints A two dim array of float

prehension(pose)[source]

Partie en développement au moment de l’arrêt du MSI S1 2022/2023

ur.backend.commands.ur_commands.all_close(goal, actual, tolerance)[source]

Convenience method for testing if the values in two lists are within a tolerance of each other. For Pose and PoseStamped inputs, the angle between the two quaternions is compared (the angle between the identical orientations q and -q is calculated correctly). @param: goal A list of floats, a Pose or a PoseStamped @param: actual A list of floats, a Pose or a PoseStamped @param: tolerance A float @returns: bool

ur.backend.commands.ur_commands.convert_deg_to_rad(tab)[source]

this function allow you to convert deg to rad. @param: tab @returns: list A list named res
